etymologies: mid 16th century: from Latin aequant- ‘making equal’, from the verb aequare

definitions: (in the Ptolemaic system) an imaginary circle introduced with the purpose of reconciling the planetary movements with the hypothesis of uniform circular motion.
shortDefinitions: (in Ptolemaic system) imaginary circle introduced with purpose of reconciling planetary movements with hypothesis of uniform circular motion

definitions: (of a crystal or particle) having its different diameters approximately equal, so as to be roughly cubic or spherical in shape.
shortDefinitions: (of crystal or particle) having its different diameters approximately equal, so as to be cubic or spherical in shape
